page.title: 12Hawarden Airport
page.content: This was particularly disappointing as an extensive survey of the needs of the Chester and North Wales area had prompted Cambrian to start the service. The route was abandoned by Cambrian in April 1970. Humber Airways applied for a licence to operate a schedule Chester-London (using Leavesden) in June 1970 but the approval was never taken up, even though Cambrian made no objection. On 6th December 1977, Air Wales began a Cardiff service with 9-seater Navajo Chieftains. Two return flights were made each week-day and for a sector time of 40 minutes it saved a long and tedious road journey. This was the first schedule through Hawarden for many years but it was to prove short-lived. By the end of March 1978 1,330 passengers had been carried, with an average load factor
